backupExplanation: You should backup your wallet whenever you generate a new address. There are two ways to backup a wallet. One is by backing up a file named wallet.dat, which contains your private keys and gives you access to your addresses. The second and the safest method is by printing the private keys and storing them in a safe place. Do not store the private keys in digital form. Export them using the function below, print them, and then delete the file. If anyone gains access to your private keys they can access your ECC.
operativeSystemNotificationDisable: Disable this option to only get notifications inside Sapphire
operativeSystemNotificationEnable: Enable this option to get operative system notifications
stakingNotificationsDisable: Disable this option to not get notified of staking rewards
stakingNotificationsEnable: Enable this option to get notified of staking rewards

unlockWalletExplanation2: You will still be required to enter a password to send

sapphireMessage1: Go ahead and click that Options icon button.
sapphireMessage2: Hey! Welcome to the preview of ECC's own Secure Messaging service.
sapphireMessage3: Part of the functionality does not work yet, but I will make sure to tell you once you try to use it.
sapphireMessage4: Please share any feedback you may have with the guys that made me. I still think I can be improved and won't take it the wrong way if you feel like I need some tweaking.
sapphireMessage5: Also, yes, emojis will be supported. Just not in this preview.
sapphireMessage7: Play around with it and let us know what you think. Sapphire will guide you through it.
sapphireMessage10: This Search option will allow you to search for messages within the chat
sapphireMessage11: The Delete option will remove the chat.
sapphireMessage12: Can't believe you tried to remove me.
sapphireMessage13: Also don't say you weren't aware of what it did, it looks like a trashcan...
sapphireMessage15: This option will allow you to send ECC to the person you are talking to.
sapphireMessage17: The File option will allow you to send a file to someone.
sapphireMessage18: The Notifications options will allow you to enable or disable the notifications of a given chat.
sapphireMessage19: This Search option will allow you to search for messages and contacts.
sapphireMessage20: We are not sure yet what this button will do but it looks good. Right now it represents the chat list.
sapphireMessage21: This button will allow you to start a new chat with someone
fileStoragePreview: *A preview of this service will be made available soon*
